story.text: (Updates with Fed minutes)NEW YORK Jan 3 (Reuters) - U.S. stocks pared gains and the Standard & Poor's 500 index .SPX fell on Wednesday on worries that inflation concerns may prompt tougher monetary policy from the Federal Reserve after the Fed released minutes of its December meeting. Fed officials agreed at their December meeting that inflation was their predominant concern, according to minutes released on Wednesday. For details, see [ID:nTRT000190] The Dow Jones industrial average .DJI was up 27.47 points, or 0.22 percent, at 12,490.62. The Standard & Poor's 500 Index .SPX was down 0.57 point, or 0.04 percent, at 1,417.73. The Nasdaq Composite Index .IXIC was up 11.19 points, or 0.46 percent, at 2,426.48.
story.title: us stocks - shares pare gains , s & p off after fed minutes
